text: It’s been a week since Adobe Max 2024 concluded, but the whole experience still feels fresh. Now that I’ve had time to reflect and get back into the swing of things, the Adobe AI tools updates have sunk in and below I share them with you. Thanks to the software brand’s AI engine, Adobe Firefly, my favorite Adobe programs have all undergone massive updates, and I appreciate how more intuitive their suite has truly become. In this article, we look at all the key Adobe AI updates! Let’s go. Creatives at Adobe Max 2024. Photo credit: Adobe Let’s take a look at some of the major updates and how they’re empowering creators like never before. Adobe AI: Photoshop’s Efficiency Boost Photoshop has always been the creative’s go-to tool for precise image editing. With its latest AI updates, it’s not just about editing anymore, but more so being able to work with unprecedented ease. The Remove Tool—now with Distraction Removal—is a terrific example. Imagine being able to brush over unwanted objects like power lines or stray tourists in a photo, and just like that, they’re gone (see what I did there?). This tool automatically detects and eliminates these distractions while keeping intact the intricate details of the whole image. And the best part? It’s smart enough to decide whether to use Adobe Firefly, its generative AI, based on whatever you’re going for. If that isn’t impressive enough, you get options too—you can adjust how much AI power you want involved in the removal process, from automatic to manual modes. What you get is more believably photorealistic images, minus the stress of manually tweaking every little detail. Unlocking Peak Productivity with AI Assistant Unlocking peak productivity with AI is no longer a distant dream—it’s a reality with Adobe’s generative AI features. Imagine being able to streamline your workflow, save precious time, and focus on what truly matters. With the AI Assistant, you can quickly scan through lengthy documents, get instant answers to your questions, and generate comprehensive summaries with just a few clicks. Whether you’re a busy professional juggling multiple projects or a student buried under a mountain of research papers, the AI Assistant is here to help. By leveraging the power of generative AI, you can work more efficiently, make data-driven decisions, and deliver exceptional results without breaking a sweat. It’s like having a personal assistant that never sleeps, always ready to boost your productivity and creativity. Introducing Adobe Sensei GenAI Meet Adobe Sensei GenAI, the game-changing generative AI that’s set to revolutionize the marketing world. As a co-pilot for marketers, GenAI empowers you to accelerate innovation and deliver personalized customer experiences like never before. Need to generate compelling content and copy? Done. Want to humanize your conversational experiences? Easy. Looking to create targeted audiences and customer journeys? Consider it handled. With Adobe Sensei GenAI, you can achieve exponential productivity, driving business growth and staying ahead of the competition. This industry-leading AI capability ensures that your marketing efforts are not just effective but also cutting-edge. It’s time to embrace the future of marketing with GenAI by your side. Generative AI Fill: Creating with Text Prompts This is where it gets even more exciting—Generative Fill allows users to create entire parts of an image by typing a simple prompt. Create stunning visuals with Generative Fill’s text prompt. Photo credit: Adobe We’ve seen this kind of technology around for a while now, but Adobe’s iteration of it is something else. In my opinion, it’s just the right amount of clean. Whether you want to add new elements to an image or remove parts without significantly altering the original visual, this tool does a wonderful job while maintaining realistic lighting, shadows, and perspective. Need a pink flamingo flying in the background? Done. Want to fill in parts of a photo that weren’t captured? Consider it finished, my creative friend. Adobe’s results are more varied, accurate, and applicable for professional and commercial projects. This feature is a wonder for creators working on anything from nature photography to detailed product shots. What used to take hours (if not days) of detailed work can now be done in minutes. Generative AI Features: Resize Without Compromise Generative Expand takes resizing to a new level. Have you ever framed a shot, only to realize the main subject is slightly off-center? Or maybe you wish you could expand the background to fit a different aspect ratio? This second question, by the way, is something I hear a lot from friends who function as all-in-one social media pros. Imagine easily turning a standard square-sized Instagram post into an immersive Story-sized photo without compromising quality! Create wider, bigger photos with Generative Expand. Photo credit: Adobe Generative Expand uses AI to seamlessly extend your canvas, creating new content that fits naturally with your original image. It blends textures, colors, and lighting so smoothly that you wouldn’t know where AI takes over and the original boundaries actually stop. This prime update saves time and allows for more creative flexibility in the composition. Adobe Illustrator: Vector Design In Seconds Adobe Illustrator is also benefiting from all of this AI magic. Adobe Illustrator’s Object on path feature straightens or curves elements cleaner. Photo credit: Adobe The new Objects on Path feature allows you to easily attach, arrange, and move objects along any path. Think about how much time you’ll save when creating intricate vector designs or working on large patterns. Another highlight I can’t wait to enjoy more is Generative Shape Fill, which improves your ability to experiment with and manipulate shapes, whether they’re hand-drawn or converted from raster graphics. If that isn’t enough, Adobe’s AI capabilities also fine-tune image tracing, converting raster images into vectors with fewer anchor points for neater and more detailed results. InDesign’s AI Assistant-Infused Layouts If you work on digital layouts a lot like me, then you’ll be thrilled to know InDesign has also been turbocharged with innovative updates. Features like Generative Expand and Text to Image allow users to edit images directly within their layouts. Need to tweak a photo’s placement or adjust the surrounding content? Its tools won’t even let you break a sweat. What’s more, designers working on complex projects like textbooks or technical documents will appreciate what the new MathML feature offers. It simplifies the integration of mathematical formulas, providing cleaner, more accessible visuals. Adobe Express: Drag-And-Drop Simplicity Meets AI Adobe Express works in both mobile and stationary devices. Photo credit: Adobe Lastly, all-around creatives who occasionally have to design images themselves will be happy to know that Adobe Express—Adobe’s web-based, drag-and-drop design tool—has also gotten some AI love. Whether you’re designing a menu, social media post, school poster, or short-form videos, the new Rewrite tool helps you rephrase, shorten, or tweak copy to fit the tone of your design. I genuinely believe this is such a helpful tool for young startup founders and business owners who don’t have that much cash to work with agencies just yet. Being able to come up with good designs and write effective copy so seamlessly just makes all the difference in the world. Animation capabilities are now AI-driven, too, making it easier to animate text, images, or shapes within your design. Adobe AI: Photoshop’s Efficiency Boost

The Remove Tool—now with Distraction Removal—is a terrific example.

Imagine being able to brush over unwanted objects like power lines or stray tourists in a photo, and just like that, they’re gone (see what I did there?).

This tool automatically detects and eliminates these distractions while keeping intact the intricate details of the whole image.

And the best part?

It’s smart enough to decide whether to use Adobe Firefly, its generative AI, based on whatever you’re going for.

If that isn’t impressive enough, you get options too—you can adjust how much AI power you want involved in the removal process, from automatic to manual modes.

What you get is more believably photorealistic images, minus the stress of manually tweaking every little detail.

Unlocking Peak Productivity with AI Assistant

Unlocking peak productivity with AI is no longer a distant dream—it’s a reality with Adobe’s generative AI features. Imagine being able to streamline your workflow, save precious time, and focus on what truly matters.

With the AI Assistant, you can quickly scan through lengthy documents, get instant answers to your questions, and generate comprehensive summaries with just a few clicks.

Whether you’re a busy professional juggling multiple projects or a student buried under a mountain of research papers, the AI Assistant is here to help.

By leveraging the power of generative AI, you can work more efficiently, make data-driven decisions, and deliver exceptional results without breaking a sweat. It’s like having a personal assistant that never sleeps, always ready to boost your productivity and creativity.

Meet Adobe Sensei GenAI, the game-changing generative AI that’s set to revolutionize the marketing world. As a co-pilot for marketers, GenAI empowers you to accelerate innovation and deliver personalized customer experiences like never before.

  • Need to generate compelling content and copy? Done.

With Adobe Sensei GenAI, you can achieve exponential productivity, driving business growth and staying ahead of the competition.

This industry-leading AI capability ensures that your marketing efforts are not just effective but also cutting-edge. It’s time to embrace the future of marketing with GenAI by your side.

Generative AI Fill: Creating with Text Prompts

This is where it gets even more exciting—Generative Fill allows users to create entire parts of an image by typing a simple prompt.

We’ve seen this kind of technology around for a while now, but Adobe’s iteration of it is something else. In my opinion, it’s just the right amount of clean.

Whether you want to add new elements to an image or remove parts without significantly altering the original visual, this tool does a wonderful job while maintaining realistic lighting, shadows, and perspective.

  • Need a pink flamingo flying in the background? Done.
  • Want to fill in parts of a photo that weren’t captured? Consider it finished, my creative friend.

Adobe’s results are more varied, accurate, and applicable for professional and commercial projects.

This feature is a wonder for creators working on anything from nature photography to detailed product shots. What used to take hours (if not days) of detailed work can now be done in minutes.

Generative AI Features: Resize Without Compromise

Generative Expand takes resizing to a new level. Have you ever framed a shot, only to realize the main subject is slightly off-center? Or maybe you wish you could expand the background to fit a different aspect ratio? This second question, by the way, is something I hear a lot from friends who function as all-in-one social media pros.

Imagine easily turning a standard square-sized Instagram post into an immersive Story-sized photo without compromising quality!

Generative Expand uses AI to seamlessly extend your canvas, creating new content that fits naturally with your original image. It blends textures, colors, and lighting so smoothly that you wouldn’t know where AI takes over and the original boundaries actually stop.

This prime update saves time and allows for more creative flexibility in the composition.

Adobe Illustrator: Vector Design In Seconds

Adobe Illustrator is also benefiting from all of this AI magic.

The new Objects on Path feature allows you to easily attach, arrange, and move objects along any path. Think about how much time you’ll save when creating intricate vector designs or working on large patterns.

Another highlight I can’t wait to enjoy more is Generative Shape Fill, which improves your ability to experiment with and manipulate shapes, whether they’re hand-drawn or converted from raster graphics.

If that isn’t enough, Adobe’s AI capabilities also fine-tune image tracing, converting raster images into vectors with fewer anchor points for neater and more detailed results.

InDesign’s AI Assistant-Infused Layouts

If you work on digital layouts a lot like me, then you’ll be thrilled to know InDesign has also been turbocharged with innovative updates.

Features like Generative Expand and Text to Image allow users to edit images directly within their layouts. Need to tweak a photo’s placement or adjust the surrounding content? Its tools won’t even let you break a sweat.

What’s more, designers working on complex projects like textbooks or technical documents will appreciate what the new MathML feature offers. It simplifies the integration of mathematical formulas, providing cleaner, more accessible visuals.

Adobe Express: Drag-And-Drop Simplicity Meets AI

Lastly, all-around creatives who occasionally have to design images themselves will be happy to know that Adobe Express—Adobe’s web-based, drag-and-drop design tool—has also gotten some AI love.

Whether you’re designing a menu, social media post, school poster, or short-form videos, the new Rewrite tool helps you rephrase, shorten, or tweak copy to fit the tone of your design.

I genuinely believe this is such a helpful tool for young startup founders and business owners who don’t have that much cash to work with agencies just yet.

Being able to come up with good designs and write effective copy so seamlessly just makes all the difference in the world.

Animation capabilities are now AI-driven, too, making it easier to animate text, images, or shapes within your design. If you’re tired of just putting out carousels and static posts, GIFs shouldn’t be too challenging to navigate now.

Express also integrates intuitively with other Adobe apps, so your Photoshop or Lightroom files are just a click away!
